name: Hardest Say What You See Trivia Quiz | TV Wordplay | 10 Questions

questions.text:
This is a sitcom, fractured.

Milk Omen Thumb It Dull
questions.explanation:
Malcolm in the Middle.

	"Malcolm in the Middle" first aired in 2000.  It spanned for seven seasons, ending in 2006.  The show starred Frankie Muniz as Malcolm, the middle child of a crazy suburban family.  He had two older brothers, Francis and Reese, as well as two younger brothers (though the youngest was not introduced until season 4's ending), Dewey and Jamie.

questions.text:
This is a fractured reality show.

Serve I've Fur
questions.explanation:
Survivor.

	The US version of "Survivor" first aired in 2000.  With two seasons occurring every year, "Survivor" had already reached season 20 by 2010.  During this time period, the show was hosted by Jeff Probst.

questions.text:
Here, I have fractured a children's cartoon.

Fin Yeah Send Fur Rib
questions.explanation:
Phineas and Ferb.

	"Phineas and Ferb" first aired in 2008 (with a preview of the show airing in 2007).  The Disney animated show features two boys, named Phineas and Ferb (go figure), who have crazy adventures every day during their summer vacation.  Candace, their older sister, does not approve of such shenanigans, however, and does everything in her power to "stop" them.  They also have a pet platypus that fights an evil Doctor Heinz Doofenshmirtz.

questions.text:
This is a reality show, in fractured form.

Sure Cat Ankh
questions.explanation:
Shark Tank.

	"Shark Tank" first aired in 2009. On the show, real life inventors and entrepreneurs sell their product in front of several filthy rich investors, known as sharks. If they are lucky, a shark will invest in that person's product. If not, they go home with nothing.

questions.text:
This is a fractured game show.

Chip Party
questions.explanation:
Jeopardy & Jeopardy!.

	"Jeopardy!" was created by Merv Griffin in 1964 and first hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek took over hosting in 1984.  The show is a quiz based game show, where players answer questions (actually, they provide the questions) about virtually any topic.

questions.text:
For a unique genre, this is a fracture of a children's soap opera.

How's a Venue Bus
questions.explanation:
House of Anubis.

	"House of Anubis" was a risky choice for Nickelodeon in early 2011, as it was the first teen soap opera ever shown on the channel. It is also a drama/mystery show. The show follows a group of teenagers on their adventures in a boarding school's house, Anubis.

questions.text:
This fractured television show is a documentary.

Riff Ermine Stirs
questions.explanation:
River Monsters.

	"River Monsters", first hosted by Jeremy Wade, debuted in 2009. The show follows Jeremy, an extreme fisherman, as he travels the globe to go fishing.  What is he looking for? Wade searches for the "Loch Nesses" of the world; supposed monsters that lurk in the earth's waters.

questions.text:
This is a fracture reality show.

Beg Gust Loose Sir
questions.explanation:
Biggest Loser & The Biggest Loser.

	The US version of "Biggest Loser" first aired in 2004 and was then hosted by Caroline Rhea.  In 2007, Alison Sweeney took over.  The show is about weight loss.  A group of obese people compete to lose the highest percentage of weight and win e grand prize and title of "Biggest Loser".

questions.text:
This is a fractured sitcom.

Aisle of Loose Sea
questions.explanation:
I love Lucy.

	"I Love Lucy" was a sitcom starring Lucille Ball.  It ran from 1951 to 1957.  The show followed Lucy, a woman who always seemed to get herself (as well as her friends) into all sorts of trouble.

questions.text:
Here is a sitcom in fractured form.

Hoe Men Proof Mint
questions.explanation:
Home Improvement.

	"Home Improvement" first aired in 1991 and ran until 1999. It starred Tim Allen as Tim Taylor, a man who seemed quite accident prone, but mostly due to the fact that he always strived for "more power".  He had three boys and a loving wife, all with problems of their own.
